content: follow the new part of the pattern with the small flowers and the sole setup instructions below hanami-socks © anna-lena trost 3 sole setup on the sole you will pick up and knit 19 sts that means 1 st for every 2 heel flap row plus first 1 sts in the corner in the next round you have to remember to knit this first st together with the last stitch of the instep to avoid a gap along the other side of the heel flap and then knit across the remaining 39 sole/gusset sts using mc and cc as follows - pick up 1 stitch in mc then follow the chart a row 47 color sequence for the first 17 sts till the red mark - place marker x shown as the red line in chart a - pick up one more st in mc it s the first st of chart b - continue to knit chart b remember to catch the floats when they are more than three sts long - place marker y shown as the red line in chart a - work remaining 17 sts according to row 47 of chart a making sure to start with the stitch behind the red mark so that the pattern matches up there is one stitch left til the instep starts now take a moment to check your stitch count the stitches in the region between markers x and y will be decreased away until only 1 stitch remain this means there should be 73 knit sts and 10 ladder back purl sts outside of the markers x and y if you picked up 19 sts along each side of the heel flap as written you will have 23 stitches between markers x and y foot finish the round knit the last st with the first st of the instep together work the instep in pattern of chart a til there is one knit st and a purl st ladder back st left put the purl st on hold knit the last knit st of the instep together with the picked up stitch in the corner rearrange the knit st and the ladder back st purl the ladder st with mc work the sole in pattern of chart a until marker x work chart b until marker y work in pattern of chart a to end repeat until the end of chart b there are 3 sts between markers x and y left now that the gusset decreases are done continue to work chart a stop until you have the desired length the toe section has got 21 rounds toe the toe will be worked entirely in mc you can knit an extra strong toe take a second thread of mc knit both threads alternating always knit the thread you hold dominant over a dominant knit st of the previous round maybe you could use the yarn from inside and outside the ball or cake for bigger sizes you
